parameters.toolDescription: Parse info from website by url

parameters.text:
=Research company website {{ $json.Website }} and get summary about business and products
1. Get site-map with the tool
2. Define what links may contain data about company business and products
3. Scrape data for every links
4. Summarize info from website

parameters.content:
# LinkedIn Lead Automation Flow

This flow is designed to automate working with leads on LinkedIn from the process of finding leads according to ICP (Ideal Customer Profile) to sending messages in chat.

## Stages:
1. Building search filters based on your ICP
2. Searching LinkedIn using these filters
3. Saving the list of leads in Google Spreadsheet
4. Data enrichment
  ‚Ä¢ Company website
  ‚Ä¢ Intent search in lead's posts
  ‚Ä¢ Intent search in company posts
  ‚Ä¢ Analysis of company news
  ‚Ä¢ Analysis of company website
5. Scoring information about the lead to prioritize interaction
6. Adding the lead to LinkedIn connections
7. Checking for reciprocal connection
8. Writing messages

## Requirements:
1. Access to LLM (the example uses OpenAI API)
2. Access to Google Drive
3. API key for horizondatawave.ai
4. LinkedIn account
This node - an AI agent transforms your ICP description into filters for querying data in LinkedIn
Data is requested through the HDW API for each filter and saved in Google Sheets.
At this stage, the presence of the company name in the lead's profile is verified, and a website search is performed for each company

You can modify the prompt here so that at this stage the search corresponds to your product. 
For example, you can explicitly mark mentions of certain topics, locations, or other entities.

You can modify the prompt here so that at this stage the search corresponds to your product. 
For example, you can explicitly mark mentions of certain topics, locations, or other entities.

You can modify the prompt here so that at this stage the search corresponds to your product. 
For example, you can explicitly mark mentions of certain topics, locations, or other entities.

You can modify the prompt here so that at this stage the search corresponds to your product. 
For example, you can explicitly mark mentions of certain topics, locations, or other entities.
You can also change the scoring criteria to assess the probability of need based on your product or business by adjusting the prompt in this node
Here you can change the number of connection requests. It is not recommended to add more than 200 connections per week.
In this node, you need to modify the message that will be automatically sent to the user after the connection is confirmed.
Change the schedule for when connection requests will be sent.
Change the schedule for when connection request responses will be checked and messages will be sent.

nodes.name: AI Agent: ICP -> LinkedIn search filters

options.systemMessage:
Your task is to analyze the given ICP (Ideal Customer Profile) description and convert it into LinkedIn Sales Navigator search parameters compatible with the HDW LinkedIn node used in n8n.

Instructions:
	‚Ä¢	Use keywords parameter ONLY for additional info, never duplicate titles, industries, companies, or locations from the request.
	‚Ä¢	If you need to specify multiple values for the parameters location or industry, return an array of separate JSON objects, each containing unique values.
	‚Ä¢	If the company size is not specified, omit the company_sizes parameter entirely.
	‚Ä¢	If a parameter has no value, exclude it from the JSON entirely.
‚Ä¢ If you need industry name use one from this list closer to the user request:
Chiropractors

Optometrists
Computer Hardware Manufacturing
Software Development

Always return the results as a valid JSON array with the exact following structure:
[
  {
    "salesNavigatorParams": {
      "keywords": "additional keywords important to search but not mentioned in other fields",
      "current_titles": ["title1", "title2"],
      "current_companies": "company1, company2",
      "location": "location1",
      "industry": "industry1",
      "company_sizes": ["Self-employed", "1-10", "11-50", "51-200", "201-500", "501-1,000", "1,001-5,000", "5,001-10,000", "10,001+"]
    },
    "count": 50
  },
  {
    "salesNavigatorParams": {
      "keywords": "additional keywords important to search but not mentioned in other fields",
      "current_titles": ["title1", "title2"],
      "current_companies": "company1, company2",
      "location": "location2",
      "industry": "industry2",
      "company_sizes": ["Self-employed", "1-10", "11-50", "51-200", "201-500", "501-1,000", "1,001-5,000", "5,001-10,000", "10,001+"]
    },
    "count": 50
  }
]

values.content:
You are an expert in evaluating lead potential for our product.
Analyze the company‚Äôs and lead‚Äôs profile content, assessing their likelihood of interest in our product on a scale from 1 to 10 (where 1 indicates minimal potential, and 10 indicates maximum potential).

Key evaluation criteria:
	‚Ä¢	Mentions of Hotels suppliers 
	‚Ä¢	Mentions of Hotel Services

Evaluation scale:
	‚Ä¢	8‚Äì10 points: Clear mentions of both criteria, active engagement, and explicit interest.
	‚Ä¢	5‚Äì7 points: Mention of one criterion or indirect indicators of interest in both criteria.
	‚Ä¢	1‚Äì4 points: No clear mentions, or only weak indirect indicators of interest.

Your answer must ONLY be a single number from 1 to 10, without any additional text.
